fields.description: I got a crash twice in a row attempting to push to a mercurial repo.
fields.summary: Crash when pushing

fields.description:
The diff view is rendering the first character of each line weirdly. Actually, it looks like it's overlaying a box character on each of them. (see screenshot)

This appears to be only happening in my .NET project, not my Java projects. So perhaps it's an issue related to line endings, or document encoding?

I did not have this problem under v1.7.x (don't remember exactly which version I was on). The bug appeared immediately after upgrading to v1.8.1.0.

Running on Windows 7 Pro SP1 x64
fields.summary: Diff view: first character weird

fields.description: Updated to SourceTree 1.8.1 and did a pull from repository. Had conflicts to resolve. Tried to Launch External Merge Tool and received "SourceTree has stopped Working" error
fields.summary: SourceTree Crashes when trying to Launch External Merge Tool
Can't use Source Tree after update to 1.8.1 Mercurial

fields.summary: Another crash when trying to click on a single item to stage

fields.description: After the latest release of the update, the application stops responding while traversing through the UI to view the files changed/deleted. The app is unable to handle a long list of modifications made to the project. This version is frustratingly buggy & nothing works.

fields.description: I have just updated the SourceTree to v1.8.1 and found out the New Feature button has disappeared from the status bar, and the only way to access the GitFlow features is from Repository/GitFlow menu which makes it little bit uncomfortable to work, especially for me at work where we embraced GitFlow. Could this be actioned in the neaxt release? Thank you
fields.summary: New Feature button not available from the status bar

fields.description: Trying to open a file from log/history panel crashes ST.
fields.summary: Trying to open file with system editor crashes SourceTree

fields.description: When the project view is refreshed either by file change, getting focus, or timed refresh, the current view tab should not switch to "File Status". Instead, the viewed tab should remain the same that was active before the refresh.
fields.summary: Not switching to "File Status" view on each refresh

fields.description:
Updated to the latest version (1.8.1.0) And getting the "ssh-agent failed error".
BTW, I've added ssh key.
screen-shot is attached
fields.summary: ssh-agent key error

fields.description:
Using verison 1.8.1.0 with a GitLab server. If I add one line at a .gitignore file in a repository, the changes are not displayed in the "changes" panel in the "File Status" or "Log / History" tabs. 

I'm adding two images demonstrating the change in the Git server and how it looks like in SourceTree.

Probably wrongly posted it at https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/STSP-3264
fields.summary: changes in .gitignore not displayed

fields.description: I was installing the program when suddenly it crashed.
fields.summary: Issue when installing
New Update generating error message

fields.description:
All of the icons in SourceTree, including the sidebar and toolbar icons, are extremely blurry. This is not an issue with SourceTree on OS X. Please use the Retina assets on OS X for Windows as well. The clash between sharp UI elements and blurry icons looks extremely inconsistent.

To replicate:

1. Set display scaling to something above 100% (preferably above 150%)
2. Open SourceTree
fields.summary: All the icons are blurry on hidpi displays (Surface Pro 4)

fields.description:
I have open a local repo, selected a branch and viewing Log/History panel (tab) selectable at the bottom of the window.

After fetch or pull operation (initiated from top menu buttons) the panel is switched to `File status` from Log/History, and that is annoying as important changes are in history
fields.summary: Maintain active Tab (window) after manual or automatic pull/fetch

fields.description: GUI changes are ugly. There is less separation between items and harder to distinguish different areas, in my opinion. Not a fan. And I can no longer right click on Branches and Add a New Branch from there.
fields.summary: GUI changes are ugly. There is less separation between items and harder to distinguish different areas, in my opinion. Not a fan. And I can no longer right click on Branches and Add a New Branch from there.

fields.description: When 'Log / History' view refreshes, the tab focus is changed to 'File Status' and then returning back to 'Log / History' view resets the scroll position.  Just annoying to lose focus and point of reference of where I was last branching or browsing and such.
fields.summary: When 'Log / History' view refreshes, the tab focus is changed to 'File Status'

fields.description: Previous versions of SourceTree supported git repositories with multiple worktrees, but SourceTree 1.8.x no longer recognises the additional worktrees as valid repositories.
fields.summary: SourceTree no longer supports secondary worktrees

fields.description:
From version 1.8.0.36401, SourceTree for Windows seems to have dropped the support for tree file listing.
With all due respect, I'm not really sure why the developers decided to do this.
It's almost a project breaker for me.
Is there a good reason behind this decision ? Will it ever come back ?
fields.summary: "Deprecated Tree File Listing in File Status and Log Views"

fields.description:
I really hate the elimination of the Git-Flow menu from the main menu bar, once finding it under the Repository menu and selecting it, it takes several seconds for it to even display the menu now.

But in trying to run it, I'm getting the following:
sh.exe C:\Users\John\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow feature start FNBMOBILE-2951
Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: Git-Flow issue

fields.description: I was prompted if I wanted to update SourceTree. I agreed and away it went. After the install/update it will not open and stay running. It crashes every time.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes on startup after update

fields.description:
I just upgraded and noticed the hg/gitflow button is gone. I now have to go to the repository menu to get access to it, is there a reason you made that task a tad harder on us?

I really hope that gets added back on the next update, as I use that a lot and having it right on the toolbar was a great resource and the main reason I use sourecetree over HG Workbench.
fields.summary: HG/GITFLOW button is no longer on the new version

fields.description:
After update to 1.8.1, viewing "Working Copy" none of the file sort options work except for "All files, sorted by path." The view does not change when choosing any other other options.

I really wish there was just a way to start typing a file name and have it autocomplete matching file names... the only view I ever care about is sorted by name, because it's the easiest way to find a file by name, but just typing a name would be so much better!
fields.summary: "Sort by" options not working in 1.8.1

fields.description: When refreshing the view or moving between branches, the Log/History view is frozen at "Loadding..." and only way to 'wake it up' is to restart the application.
fields.summary: Log/History stuck at "Loading..."
After update crashed on registration and now crashes on launch

fields.description:
git-flow commands launched with one backslash in path:

    $ sh.exe C:\Users\my_name\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow init -d

But it needs to be:

    $ sh.exe C:\\Users\\my_name\\AppData\\Local\\Atlassian\\SourceTree\\gitflow_local\\gitflow\\git-flow init -d
fields.summary: git-flow commands launched using only single backslash

fields.description:
the diff view is scrollable but in 1.7.x it was only the code lines that are scrolled. in 1.8.x the whole view is scrolled so that I can see code OR I can see the buttons on the right. (see screenshop)
THIS IS NOT ACCEPTABLE

It would be nice to know where I can download 1.7.x again to continue working...
fields.summary: Diff view hides important buttons for blockwise committing

fields.description:
I have just updated to 1.8.1 (btw, why does Jira tell me it is unreleased?).

Now in the File Status view when i have staged a few files, and selected one of them to see the diff again, and I then select an unstaged file, It still shows me the diff of the staged file. It will not show me the diff of the unstaged file.

*Update:* I have attached a screenshot to show the issue.
fields.summary: Unstaged diff will not show

fields.description:
When going to the commit screen for a given Git repository, the window itself looks very buggy/splotchy, especially around the "changes" of the files. But the worst part is that the screen *never updates by itself*. Move a file from unstaged to stage? You have to flip to the Log/History tab and then back to File Status. Want to see a different change preview of another file? Flip. Sometimes it takes multiple "move to staging" tries for it to even work. Deleted files on disk are even harder to make read as deleted (I actually had to open the terminal and add them!). I can't even drag and drop files from the unstaged to staging area anymore.

This is a very messy release since 1.8 and things changed hands, apparently. Not part of the bug but the UI here looks particularly worse.
fields.summary: Commit screen never updates on its own and has very buggy UI

fields.description:
1. Delete a file tracked by git
2. In the list of unstaged files, check the box for the deleted file

Expected: this file is staged
Actual: error message:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false rm -q -f -- filename
fatal: pathspec 'filename' did not match any files"
fields.summary: Cannot stage deleted file

fields.description:
1. A bunch of changed files
2. Stage some of them
3. Click a staged file to view diff
4. click an unstaged file to view diff

Expected: I see diff for correct file
Actual: I see diff for the file I clicked in step 3
[Recording|http://recordit.co/4HMId53MCE]
fields.summary: Diff shown for wrong file
crash on start of SourceTree

fields.description:
Popup says:
"Error encountered"
'ssh-agent' failed with code -1: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.

Works in old version.
fields.summary: OpenSSH does not work in new SourceTree version

fields.description: In the File status tab, the current user's name is shown in white text on light gray background, totally unreadable.
fields.summary: Unreadable white text on gray background

fields.description:
In "Working Copy" view:
when I stage one file its changes summary preview is showed on the right pane.
Selecting an unstaged file continue to show the preview of the already staged file.
In order to view the other files I have to unstage all already staged files.
fields.summary: Staged files does not allow to show changes of unstaged files

fields.description: When a file has multiple changed hunks, the hunks are shown with different width. This looks jarring and broken and makes it harder for me to focus on the actual diffs.
fields.summary: Background width differs by hunk

fields.description:
Under file status:
After updating to SourceTree 1.8.1 I can no longer view my files in a tree view.
In fact it is impossible to view things in any other way than Flat list and Split view staging.
fields.summary: Tree listing is missing

fields.description:
When opening a pranch in Stash and selecting [...][Check out in Source Tree], then the branch doesn't get added to the branches folder and checked out in Source tree. 

Manual adding the branch in SourceTree does work.
fields.summary: Checkout Branch via Stash - Branch gets not added to branches

fields.description:
When i switch between staged and unstaged files the files i opened before doesn't get unselect .

So when i switch from staged to unstaged both will be open.

I have to unselect them by myself.

Sorry my English is not the best.
fields.summary: switching checked/unchecked doesnt unselect selected file

fields.description: After upgrading to 1.8.1.0 on Windows 10 when working in the staging files area the incorrect file diffs are shown in the right column after selecting a single file to be included in the commit. Any file I select after that point to view and evaluate for inclusion in the commit loads and shows the diff from the already staged file.
fields.summary: File staging shows incorrect file hunks on right

fields.description:
!SourceTree.JPG|thumbnail! 
On one of our installations the Graph does not fit to the rest of the table ... it has an Offset of half a line to top!
fields.summary: Presentationproblem - Graph dosn't line up with table

fields.description:
Prompted to update to 1.8.1 from 1.7.0.

Update went ahead fine.

Try to maximise main window, application freezes and will not respond.

Could only use the updated version in the standard size smaller window.
fields.summary: SourceTree freezes when maximizing UI window

fields.description:
When I try to do anything in SourceTree so far its happened when: Opening a menu, trying to update a branch(hg) clicking on a revision and changing tabs.

It is unusable and I will be going back to version 1.7.

Windows 10 64bit Intel i5 16gb ram 430gb SSD
fields.summary: Windows 10 Crashing Source Tree 1.8.1
Double-clicked to view file contents in Log/History causes repeatable crash
Installing crash

fields.summary: После обновления до версии 1.8.1.0 не подключается Mercurial

fields.summary: Crash when staging file(s)

fields.description: Log/ history tab shows modified file correctly. When you try to show the modified file in the File status tab, it says the modified file is updated (Green thumb icon). Also it shows the file secondly under a selected stage file. When you stage the modified file it shows correctly. But when you go back to the Log/ history tab and then go back to the File status tab, the file get setted updated.
fields.summary: File status sets modified file to updated

fields.description:
After update SourceTree from 1.6.x the Mercurial support can't be enabled.
"SourceTree: Mercurial not found" window with several options appears. Next actions don't solve the problem.

See video for details: http://screencast.com/t/BNi6mldfa3E
fields.summary: Hg not found. Can't enable Mercurial support.

fields.description: When I'm preparing a commit and have clicked a staged file to view its diff, a click on an unstaged file doesn't show its diff anymore. I have to stage and unstage the file to get the diff. It doesn't matter whether I'm in the Log/History view or in the File Status view. And after having staged the file, I have to stage and unstage the next file before I can review its diff.
fields.summary: Diff view doesn't work correctly

fields.description: When I try to open a .resx file, SourceTree crashes. In the log it says there is no associated application to open the file.
fields.summary: Crash when trying to open .resx file

fields.description:
Crash after start after update on 1.8.1.0.
No idea why, what component exactly.
Crash data + log is added.

sourcetree-details.log is empty.

It launches on second try without the error.
fields.summary: Crash after Update

fields.description:
Every time I refresh the view in the `Log/History` tab, Sourcetree switches over to the `File Status` tab. This is _incredibly_ irritating.

The latest update has introduced (1.8.0?) numerous issues. Stupid UX issues like this are the straws that end up breaking the camel's back.

Please fix this so that I don't have to switch to GitExt to save my sanity.
fields.summary: Don't switch to `File Status` on refresh

fields.description:
In File Status panel, displaying hunks does not work for unstaged files.

How to repeat:
Select one file as "staged" and then select that file row in "staged files" to display its hunks in right. After that clicking any "unstaged" files does not update hunk display in right, so you're unable to display hunks for unstaged files.

This can be recovered by moving any file between staged & unstaged. However, after selecting any staged file row, the problem recurs.
fields.summary: File Status panel: Unable to view hunk for unstaged files after staging one file

fields.description:

I attach the diagnostic.log

fields.description: SourceTree 1.7 was working fine. Today i updated it to 1.8. After update, when ever i open the app it shows a error message with Report bug or Cancel button. Report bug takes me here and Cancel is closing the app. Screens attached.
fields.summary: App open with error message on startup
